creator: skmami@yahoo.com
text:
Created attachment 24177
Attached is the jmeter.log file. 

I am trying to use the JMeter to publish to a Topic hosted on IBM WebSphere
Application Server. I was successfully able to do the point to point and now
moved to the JMS Publisher part but I am having an issue where Jmeter stops
after the following statement is printed. 

2009/08/27 11:44:33 INFO  - jmeter.protocol.jms.client.InitialContextFactory:
created the JNDI initial context factory 

My JMeter shows it my test is still running. 


Please find the attached Jmeter.log. 

I have the following settings for the JMS Publisher.

IntialContextFactory : com.ibm.websphere.naming.WsnInitialContextFactory
provider URL: iiop://xxxxxx:9810
Connection Factory: jms/PSExampleConnectionFactory
Topic: jms/PSExampleTopic2
configuration : Text Area
Message type: Text Message
jms_text_message: some sample message

Hello,
You could provide helpful info by creating 5 Thread Dumps each 10seconds when this problem occurs.
To do so enable JMX or under Linux use kill -3 on your process and send Thread Dump

Philippe
http://www.ubik-ingenierie.com
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Hello, 

Please can you provide instructions on how to create a dump. I am running in Windows XP. I do not know how to enable JMX. 

Thanks
Satish
creator: skmami@yahoo.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
Install a JDK 6 (JMX will be enabled by default)
Run JMEter
Then go to JDK Home and in bin folder start visualvm:
http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/visualvm/applications_local.html

Regards
Philippe Mouawad
http://www.ubik-ingenierie.com

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Closing as not enough information and since many fixes has been made on JMS published in 2.4, 2.5 and 2.5.1.


If it happens again, please provide:
- Test plan
- Thread dumps as described in comment
